conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to analyze the velocity-time (vt) graph for both Car A and Car B and understand how their accelerations change over time.
The graph shows velocity (v) on the vertical axis and time (t) on the horizontal axis.
Car A starts with a velocity of v2 and ends with a velocity of v1 at time t1.
Car B starts with a velocity of v1 and ends with a velocity of v2 at time t1.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time. It is represented by the slope of the vt graph.

premise: The graph shows a curve for Car A that starts steep and becomes less steep as time progresses.
conclusion: The magnitude of acceleration for Car A is decreasing over time.

premise: The graph shows a curve for Car B that starts less steep and becomes steeper as time progresses.
conclusion: The magnitude of acceleration for Car B is increasing over time.

conclusion: Car A has a higher magnitude of acceleration than Car B at t = 0.

premise: At t = t1, Car B has a higher magnitude of acceleration than Car A because its graph is steeper.
conclusion: Car B has a higher magnitude of acceleration than Car A at t = t1.

conclusion: This is consistent with the description given in the problem and the shape of the curves on the graph.
